basics.name: Carson D. Broeker
basics.label: Research Scientist
basics.summary: Oncology researcher with a penchant for bioinformatics, data science, and machine learning

work.name: Department of Biochemistry and Molecular Biology, Michigan State University
work.summary: Engaged in many different research project broadly relating to mouse models of breast cancer and their development, genomics of breast cancer models, and developing artificial intelligence models to study breast cancer

work.name: AbbVie
work.summary: Created an autonomous centralized database for non-regulated bioanalysis method information, along with a machine learning pipeline for small molecule method prediction. Created a web application for querying database and method prediction information

work.name: Institute for Cyber-Enabled Research, Michigan State University
AbbVie
work.summary: Created an application for the automatic processing of mass spectrometry data identifying novel metabolites from animal specimens treated with small molecule pharmaceuticals. This application also matched MS1 peak data to MS2+ peak data to determine level of support across different fragmention ions. Created automated workflows for other small department needs

work.name: Covid-19 Early Detection Program, Michigan State University
work.summary: Responsible for processing incoming spit samples with chemical stabilization, RNA extraction, and preparation for qRT-PCR

courses: Methods in Macromolecular Analysis and Synthesis
Calculus Based Physics I and II
Labs in Biology, Chemistry, Biochemistry, and Physics

awards.title: Ruth L. Kirschstein Predoctoral Individual National Research Service Award (F31)
awards.summary: The NCI Ruth L. Kirschstein NRSA for Individual Predoctoral Fellows (F31) Award supports promising doctoral candidates who will perform dissertation research and training for a PhD degree in a scientific health-related field relevant to the mission of the NCI during the tenure of the award.

awards.title: Aitch Foundation Predoctoral Fellowship Award
awards.summary: The Aitch Foundation supports awareness of and generates charitable contributions for research into early detection of hidden cancers.

publications.name: Integrative multi-omic sequencing reveals the MMTV-Myc mouse model mimics human breast cancer heterogeneity
publications.summary: This paper explores the heterogeneity found at the transcriptional and genomic level of MMTV-Myc mouse model tumors. We also find that many mouse models widely described as being representative of specific human breast cancer subtypes are quite heterogeneous and do not replicate the transcriptional state of the supposed matching human breast cancer subtype.

publications.name: E2F Transcription Factors in Cancer, More than the Cell Cycle
publications.summary: In this review, we detail the canonical and noncanonical functions of E2F transcription factors. While widely known to be important regulators of the cell cycle, E2F transcription factors take on a variety of other rules, including but not limited to apoptosis, DNA repair, angiogenesis, etc.

publications.name: Large-Scale SARS-CoV-2 Testing Utilizing Saliva and Transposition Sample Pooling
publications.summary: Herein, we detail a high throughput method of transpositional pooled saliva sampling for detection of Covid-19 in the Michigan State University student body.

publications.name: Insight into mammary gland development and tumor prevention in a newly developed metastatic mouse model of breast cancer
publications.summary: Previously unknown to play a role in breast cancer development, we detail the novel conditional E2F5 knockout mouse model. We profile the mouse model at the genomic and transcriptional level.

keywords: Scientific Dissemination to Advanced and Lay Audiences
